intro: Mariscus andringitrensis, commonly known as the Andringitra marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fleshy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
